sub_topic: Finding the minimum spanning tree of a graph.
message_1:
A construction company wants to connect 6 cities in a region with minimum cost. The distance (in kilometers) between each pair of cities is given below:

|     | City 1 | City 2 | City 3 | City 4 | City 5 | City 6 |
|-----|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|
|City 1|   0   |   4    |   2    | 999999 | 999999 | 999999 |
|City 2|   4   |   0    |   3    | 7      | 999999 | 999999 |
|City 3|   2   |   3    |   0    | 5      | 8      | 999999 |
|City 4|999999|   7    |   5    |   0    |   2    |   6    |
|City 5|999999|999999|   8    |   2    |   0    |   3    |
|City 6|999999|999999|999999|   6    |   3    |   0    |

Using Prim's algorithm, find the minimum spanning tree for this network and determine the total distance (in kilometers) it covers.
